title: Passport of Erik Nordström
description: Swedish passport found next to mooring post 7. Belongs to Erik Nordström, born 1978. Last entry stamp: Bergen, Norway, 3 days ago. No exit stamp. Passport appears water-damaged.
transcript:
Name: Erik Nordström
Birth: 1978
Nationality: Swedish
Status: Missing person
Last known location: Bergen Harbor
Notes: Found at crime scene with no exit stamp from Norway.

title: Security Camera Footage - Dock
description: Color security footage from dock entrance. Timestamp: 02:47 AM. Shows figure in dark clothing carrying green duffel bag.
transcript: 02:47 AM - Figure enters dock from south entrance. Dark hoodie, impossible to see face. Walks with slight limp on left leg. Carrying green duffel bag approximately 1 meter in length. Estimated weight: 20-30 kg based on movement. Person appears familiar with the area, walks directly toward Pier C without hesitation.

title: Harbormaster's Log Entry
description: Official log from night of incident. Notes unusual fog and strange sounds.
transcript:
01:15 - Unusual fog rolling in. Visibility poor.
03:20 - Heard metallic scraping sound from Pier C. Investigated but fog too thick to see anything.
05:30 - Fog cleared. Discovered container C-23 missing from scheduled location.
Signed: Henrik Larsen, Harbormaster

title: Cargo Manifest - MS Nordic Star
description: Shipping manifest dated 4 days ago. Container C-23 marked as electronics.
transcript:
MANIFEST - MS NORDIC STAR
Date: 4 days prior
Origin: Shanghai Port
Destination: Oslo Port

Container C-23:
Category: Electronics
Declared Contents: Samsung components
Declared Weight: 2400 kg
Actual Weight (Sealed): UNKNOWN
Status: MISSING

title: Interview: Lina Haugen
description: Police interview with dock worker Lina Haugen.
transcript:
Officer: Where were you between 01:00 and 04:00?
Lina: I was on break. Took a walk away from the dock.
Officer: Did you see anyone unusual?
Lina: Maybe... someone near Pier C around 2 AM. Couldn't see clearly.
Officer: Do you know this person?
Lina: No, I don't think so. Never seen them before.
[Voice analysis shows signs of stress and hesitation]

title: Anonymous Tip Recording
transcript: Male voice, Scandinavian accent: 'Silent Harbour. Check the old warehouse on Pier C. Look for Container C-23. Not what it seems. The semiconductor equipment inside is worth millions. Check the water nearby.' [Call traced to burner phone, untraceable]

title: Erik Nordström - Background
transcript:
BACKGROUND CHECK - ERIK NORDSTRÖM
Age: 46
Occupation: Former executive, Scandinavian Maritime Ltd
Fired: 6 months ago for irregularities in cargo documentation
Criminal Record: None
Financial Status: Significant debts
Location History: Frequent visits to Bergen harbor area
Associations: Unknown

title: Lina Haugen - Personnel File
description: Dock worker personnel and background information.
transcript:
PERSONNEL FILE - LINA HAUGEN
Position: Dock Worker
Employment Duration: 8 years (exemplary record until 3 months ago)
Warnings: 2 written warnings for unauthorized access to restricted areas
Family: Single mother of two
Medical: Sister diagnosed with expensive medical condition
Financial: Recent financial hardship
Behavior Change: Notable shift 3 months ago

title: Henrik Larsen - Statement
transcript:
WITNESS STATEMENT - HENRIK LARSEN
Position: Harbormaster (30 years experience)
Statement: 'I've never seen fog that thick. Couldn't see 3 meters ahead. The visibility was unnatural. When it cleared at dawn, the container was simply gone. No boat trails, no signs of removal. It's as if it vanished.'

title: Newspaper - Bergens Tidende
description: Front page newspaper article about the disappearance.
transcript:
BERGENS TIDENDE - HEADLINE (2 days ago)
'MYSTERIOUS DISAPPEARANCE AT HARBOR'
Container worth millions vanishes in night fog. Police baffled.
An investigation is underway at Bergen Harbor after a valuable shipping container disappeared overnight. The container, reportedly containing electronics worth several million NOK, vanished without a trace during unusual fog conditions.

title: Warehouse Interior - Crime Scene Photo
description: Crime scene photograph of Pier C warehouse interior.
transcript:
CRIME SCENE ANALYSIS - PIER C WAREHOUSE
Observations:
- Forklift tracks visible on concrete floor leading to back exit
- Fresh oil stains on ground
- Broken pallet wood scattered near loading bay
- Security camera visibly disabled (cable cut)
- Back exit door found unlocked
- No signs of forced entry

title: Text Messages - Lina's Phone
description: Recovered text messages from Lina Haugen's phone.
transcript:
RECOVERED TEXT MESSAGES
01:47 AM: 'Is ready. Coast clear.'
02:15 AM (reply): 'Good. Proceed as planned.'
03:45 AM: 'It's done. When payment?'
[Messages were deleted but recovered by forensics. Recipient unknown. Sent to burner phone.]

title: Bank Transaction - Lina Haugen
transcript:
BANK TRANSACTION RECORD
Account: Lina Haugen
Date: 1 day after incident
Amount: 150,000 NOK (approximately 14,000 USD)
Origin: Offshore account (Cyprus)
Memo: 'Consulting services'
Status: Untraced source, no legitimate business relation

title: Container C-23 - True Contents
description: Confidential customs report revealing actual cargo.
transcript:
CONFIDENTIAL CUSTOMS REPORT
Container C-23 Actual Contents:
- Prototype semiconductor manufacturing equipment
- Classification: Export restricted technology
- Estimated Value: 4.2 million USD
- Intended Destination (Black Market): Eastern Europe or Asia
- Technology Level: Advanced - critical infrastructure applications
This cargo should have been flagged for inspection upon arrival.

title: Weather Report - Bergen Harbor
transcript:
METEOROLOGICAL REPORT - BERGEN HARBOR
Incident Night Analysis:
Fog Onset: 01:20 AM
Visibility: Dropped to near-zero within 15 minutes (highly unusual)
Duration: 4 hours 10 minutes
Clearance: 05:30 AM (abrupt, atypical for natural fog)
Local Observations: Fishermen report fog pattern was 'unnatural'
Conclusion: While fog is common in Bergen, the timing and intensity were statistically anomalous.

title: GPS Log - Vessel Movements
description: Automated GPS log of vessel movements in and out of the harbor.
transcript:
GPS LOG - BERGEN HARBOR
Date: Incident Night

00:15 - MS Nordic Star - Arrival Berth 2
00:47 - Coastal Carrier - Departure Berth 5
01:18 - Arctic Swan - Departure Berth 4 (last vessel out)
01:20 - Fog reported by harbormaster
05:30 - Fog cleared
06:15 - Morning Fisher - Arrival Berth 1

NOTE: Arctic Swan left harbor just 2 minutes before fog onset. Destination: Rotterdam.

title: Interview: Henrik Larsen (Initial)
description: First police interview with harbormaster Henrik Larsen, taken immediately after discovery.
transcript:
Officer: Mr. Larsen, when did you first notice something was wrong?
Henrik: Around 05:30. The fog lifted suddenly, and I did my usual rounds. That's when I saw container C-23 was missing from the manifest position.
Officer: Was there any sign of forced entry or equipment used?
Henrik: None whatsoever. The loading equipment was all accounted for. The gate logs showed no vehicles entering after midnight.
Officer: Had you noticed anything suspicious in the days before?
Henrik: Well... now that you mention it, Erik Nordström had been hanging around more than usual. He was terminated from Scandinavian Maritime months ago but kept showing up.

title: Interview: Marcus Olsen (Night Security)
description: Interview with night security guard on duty during the theft.
transcript:
Officer: What time did your shift start?
Marcus: 22:00 hours. Everything was normal until around 01:00 when the fog rolled in.
Officer: Did you see anyone entering or leaving?
Marcus: I did see Lina Haugen leaving the main building around 01:45. She said she was taking her break early because she wasn't feeling well. But her shift doesn't usually have breaks at that time.
Officer: Did you see where she went?
Marcus: Toward Pier C, I think. But the fog got so thick I lost sight of her almost immediately. I assumed she went to the break room near the warehouse.
Officer: Anything else unusual?
Marcus: The cameras on Pier C went offline at 02:43. I reported it but was told to wait until morning for maintenance.

title: Interview: Sara Johansen (Dock Worker)
description: Interview with colleague of Lina Haugen.
transcript:
Officer: How well do you know Lina Haugen?
Sara: We've worked together for 5 years. She's always been reliable, never late, never caused problems.
Officer: Have you noticed any changes in her behavior recently?
Sara: Actually, yes. About 3 months ago she started acting... stressed. Money problems, I think. Her sister got diagnosed with some rare condition that requires expensive treatment.
Officer: Did she ever mention needing money?
Sara: Once she asked if I knew anyone hiring for weekend work. She seemed desperate. And last week I saw her talking to someone in the parking lot late at night. A man, couldn't see his face clearly, but he was wearing expensive clothes. Didn't seem like someone from around here.
Officer: Did Lina seem nervous about this meeting?
Sara: No, that's the strange part. She seemed... focused. Like she was planning something.
